scenarioDescription:
The 51 Eri Exoplanetary System


Overview

51 Eri is a star with 1.65 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.49 times its radius. It is located 97.06 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.02 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

51 Eri is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 51 Eri system


51 Eri b

51 Eri b was discovered by the Gemini Observatory observatory, in 2015-00, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 12.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 51 Eri b is 636.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 51 Eri b is 13.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 51 Eri b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 51 Eri, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Gemini Observatory.
name: 51 Eri - System With 1 Exoplanet
